item.description:
I had no idea Mozart even had a sister, let alone a musical one. Like all films in the Festival, I suggest you get your tickets in advance.

About the film:

Mozart’s Sister (Nannerl, la s œur de Mozart) by René Féret (2010, 120 min.). A speculative account of Maria Anna “Nannerl” Mozart (Marie Féret), five years older than Wolfgang (David Moreau) and a musical prodigy in her own right. Originally the featured performer, she has given way to Wolfgang as the main attraction, as their strict but loving father Leopold (Marc Barbe) tours his talented offspring in front of the royal courts of pre–French Revolution Europe. Approaching marriageable age and now forbidden to play the violin or compose, Nannerl chafes at the limitations imposed by her gender, but a friendship with the son and daughter of Louis XV offers an alternative.

"Feminist without the arrogance of 20-20 hindsight, vividly precise in its depiction of 18th-century pre-revolutionary France (the filmmakers were allowed to shoot inside Versailles), alive with exuberantly thesped personages and awash in the joy and power of music, the pic is a stunner." -- Variety 

After the film we'll go to an area restaurant for discussion.

Hope to see you there!

Lisa
item.how_to_find_us: After the film I'll be near the front of the theater with a Meetup sign.
item.name: Mozart's Sister
